articles.title: OpenAI Wants You to Get a Certificate in ChatGPT and Find Your Next Job
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence company plans to add certifications and a jobs platform to help companies find workers "actually fluent in AI."
articles.translated_title: OpenAI Wants You to Get a Certificate in ChatGPT and Find Your Next Job
articles.translated_summary: The artificial intelligence company plans to add certifications and a jobs platform to help companies find workers "actually fluent in AI."

articles.title: AI firm plans to reconstruct 'lost' footage from Orson Welles' 'The Magnificent Ambersons'
articles.summary: Showrunner, a tech platform, plans to use artificial intelligence to reconstruct 43 minutes of excised footage from Orson Welles' "The Magnificent Ambersons."

articles.summary: The playoff-bound Ballers of the independent Pioneer League are turning to AI to manage most aspects of Saturday‚Äôs home game against the Great Falls Voyagers at Raimondi Park.

articles.title: Tesla shareholders to vote on xAI investment in November
articles.summary: Tesla Inc. shareholders will vote in November to decide if the electric carmaker should invest in Elon Musk's closely held artificial intelligence startup, xAI.

articles.title: Why Docusign Stock Is Surging Friday
articles.summary: Docusign posted strong quarterly results and boosted its outlook as it added more customers and expanded its artificial intelligence offerings.

articles.title: Warner Bros. Sues Midjourney for AI-Generated Images of Superman, Bugs Bunny and Other Characters
articles.summary: Warner Bros. is suing artificial intelligence company Midjourney for copyright infringement, alleging that the startup enables its millions of subscribers to create AI-generated images and videos of copyrighted characters like Superman and Bugs Bunny.
articles.translated_title: Warner Bros. Sues Midjourney for AI-Generated Images of Superman, Bugs Bunny and Other Characters

articles.title: AI scammers target sports fans with celebrity deepfakes
articles.summary: Scammers are using artificial intelligence to create convincing fake images and videos of celebrities and athletes, targeting unsuspecting fans with sophisticated schemes
